Title: Reporter/MMJ - Spectrum News Ohio
Description:
Tired of the constant spot news chase and the breaking news rush that ends with a 11pm live shot outside an empty building? At Spectrum News, we are seeking innovative and creative Multimedia Journalists who want to deliver stories that matter to viewers across our state. In a world of sensationalism, hyperbole, and cookie-cutter content, our MMJ storytellers are the essential agents of change we want to bring to viewers. Written and visual storytelling is the hallmark of journalism, and the priority should be on the story, and what it means, and not necessarily how quickly it gets told. Our MMJs are able to tell stories in different ways from in front of, and behind the camera, creating an opportunity to redefine the local news landscape in the state. These stories should reflect and celebrate the people and values of our state.

Spectrum Networks is looking for enthusiastic, talented and driven individuals to join the best and brightest in gathering, producing and delivering news that make a difference within a 24-hour breaking news environment!

THE ENVIRONMENT
Spectrum News is a 24-hour breaking news network which requires employees who are flexible and available to work various shift, including early morning, late evenings, weekends and holidays.

JOIN OUR JOURNEY IF…
You’re ready to inspire and be inspired! You’re passionate, creative and highly technical, driven to flourish in a competitive, fast-paced environment. You're fiercely accurate, with a desire to leverage your knowledge, skills and abilities to share news stories to viewers our local communities. You're nimble, having the ability to pivot in an ever-changing workflow. You are a team player with a positive attitude and strong interpersonal skills. You have the ability to multi-task, meet tight deadlines and remain calm under pressure.


JOB SUMMARY
Research, develop, write, edit, shoot and live presentation of news stories on deadline. Contribute to special features and stories. Participate in coordinating coverage of major stories, breaking news and specials.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Create original news stories; gather information for news stories using beat sources, contacts and leads
Build contacts and sources within the assigned bureau’s community
Report within assigned deadlines
Deliver news reports, including live reports, demonstrating energy, confidence, professional appearance and voice quality
Write, shoot and edit own news stories for an assigned newscast or news series
Combine video, audio and graphics to tell the story effectively
Work with a photographer on occasion
Work with assignment desk editors and master control operators and independently in the newsgathering process
Manage general upkeep of assigned company equipment
Responsible for representing channel in a professional manner
Establish a community presence outside of the newscasts
Perform other duties as assigned
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Must have sufficiently strong story development skills to submit original story ideas on a daily basis
Live shot experience required
Must be able to develop sources, work a beat, and break stories
Must have strong on-camera skills
Must have ability to organize and manage multiple priorities and work under time pressure deadline
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Ability to clearly communicate solutions
Ability to relate well with diverse populations and age groups
Ability to interface with internal company personnel
Ability to handle breaking news on-air
Requires adaptability, enthusiasm, initiative and a positive approach to problem solving
Must obtain and maintain a valid driver’s license for authorized driving in the State of residence
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Journalism or related field or comparable television work experience preferred

Related Work Experience

3 Years Television news reporting experience


WORKING CONDITIONS
Works inside in a climate controlled environment and outside throughout the year and may be subjected to various weather conditions that could include extreme heat or cold conditions
Must be able to work under time pressure deadlines and willing and able to work different shifts or longer shifts due to "breaking news" and severe weather emergencies. Willing and able to work weekends and holidays
Lifting and carrying up to 70 pounds

OUR CULTURE
Spectrum Networks is a growing organization, with 31 Networks across 12 States. Our commitment is to create relevant, timely content essential in the day to day lives of the people who live in the communities we serve. Additionally, our breadth allows us to share relevant content across our nation-wide networks, increasing our opportunity to share timely stories. We truly believe in continually redefining and re-establishing how we engage with our viewers and their local communities. Each Spectrum Networks’ employee is an influencer and culture keeper. We expect respectful communication (despite pressure), openness to feedback, an eagerness to learn, and an overall positive attitude!

The digital design fellowship sits in the middle of technology, design and journalism. Title: Associate Editor / Senior Editor
Description:
Scientific American, the longest continuously published magazine in the U.S., has been bringing its readers unique insights about developments in science and technology since 1845. Scientific American has 3.5 million print and tablet readers worldwide, more than 7.5 million visitors on ScientificAmerican.com, and appears in 13 translated editions, which are read in more than 30 countries.
Scientific American seeks an experienced editor/reporter to cover health, medical and biology-related news. We are the world’s most authoritative popular science media outlet, with ambitions to expand our journalism on all platforms to better serve our audience of science enthusiasts and thought leaders—now more than 9 million globally and growing quickly.
This editor will be a key member of our news team and will be responsible for covering the health/medical beat on all platforms (website, print, social media, etc.) and in all forms (short- and long-form writing, video, podcasts, etc.). This is a core beat area at Scientific American, which drives large amounts of traffic and engagement. The editor will work closely with the editorial team to report, write and edit timely articles and analyses, make freelance assignments, locate partner coverage, produce weekly newsletters and develop special reports/packages in order to meet Scientific American’s editorial objectives and goals. The editor will also promote content and engage readership via social media and other channels, and make media and public speaking appearances. In assessing candidates’ suitability for this role, special emphasis will be placed on the demonstrated ability to generate new and unique ideas for health, medical and biology-related news coverage, and to write and edit grammatically precise, well-structured copy that is polished, professional and engaging for a general audience.

Requirements:
Educated to degree level
Minimum 3 years of experience as a journalist covering life sciences issues
In-depth knowledge of health, medical and biology-related science, industry news, research and developments, and grasp of current events and trends in these areas
Excellent communication, reporting, writing and editing skills
Command and comfort with journalistic values, best practices and standards
Familiarity with advanced reporting techniques such as investigations, data journalism, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests and multimedia
Demonstrated skill in working with teams, especially in digital media
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills, including the ability to multi-task and work on deadline
Command and comfort with social media best practices and standards
Familiarity and comfort with online media analytics



We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes:
Medical, Dental and Vision
Life and AD&D
401(k)
Flexible Spending Accounts
Transit Accounts
Tuition Assistance
Summer Hours

Springer Nature is the world’s largest academic book publisher, publisher of the world’s highest impact journals and a pioneer in the field of open research. Title: Manager of News & Content
Description:
The University of Alaska is actively recruiting for a Manager of News & Content to join our University Relations team. Reporting to the Associate Vice President for Public Affairs (AVP), this position will be the primary content developer for all UR communication vehicles and the primary staffer for a news bureau-like suite of products including videography, website, legislative advocacy, newsletters, graphics for communications, social media video creation, podcasts, Facebook Live or Google Hangout sessions, news releases, and marketing materials.


Duties:
100Assisting with the production of publications, such as in-house newsletters; creating content for UA web pages including special project pages [UA leadership campus free speech, advocacy, etc.] Monitoring media, including newspapers, magazines, journals, broadcasts, newswires, social media sites and blogs, for opportunities. Creating a dashboard to depict communication outcomes of press coverage, public appearances, social media, etc. Coordinating studio or location photography. Producing regular video news releases for dissemination to news outlets. Creating graphics for website, marketing materials or other applications. Creating social media posts including photograph and videography. Facilitate online conversations with various audiences and respond to queries. Assist in the editing and distribution of media releases, advisories, internal and external communications. Working to develop/coordinate content for dissemination online, via social media or in publications/broadcast. Researching, writing and distributing communications to targeted media. Execute media relations tactics from identification of media pitching opportunities to media briefing to managing an editorial calendar of story opportunities. Establish and cultivate local and national media relationships with mainstream, education-related and UA college-specific publications. Continually refine pitches and distribution lists for national and regional media. Working with campus communicators to create and maintain an editorial calendar in order to anticipate opportunities to provide/promote relevant content. Implementing communication plans and media outreach for special programs, events and major initiatives. Editing regular news summaries that includes all the coverage of the UA and its leaders, faculty, students, employees and researchers that appears locally, regionally, nationally and internationally. Maintaining regular contact and building strong relationships with journalists covering education and related issues; audit media to keep abreast of higher education coverage. Assisting UR/VP and AVP with crisis communications preparedness, response and evaluation.Essential
The person in this position will be responsible for managing the news function, which includes developing an online news site; overseeing the curation and creation of compelling content from across the system; maintaining a proactive media relations program for UA; assisting the AVP in publicizing the university and assisting in the operations of university communications.

The Manager of News & Content is responsible for the day-to-day news operations and for curating, editing [including video editing and podcasts] and strategically distributing content through news media, social media and the university’s channels including the internal SW e-newsletter. This position will help execute overall communications and media relations plan. Most importantly, this position will ensure close integration between internal communication messaging, external messaging and university marketing.

The person in this position will have a strong news sense and solid writing and editing skills, and also will be able to effectively mentor content producers in generating and developing compelling content, both written and visual.

Strong graphic design skills
Proven work experience as a social media coordinator
Expertise in multiple social media platforms
Ability to deliver creative content (text, image, and video)
In-depth knowledge of SEO, keyword research and Google Analytics
Familiarity with online marketing strategies and marketing channels
Digital video filming and editing skills
Excellent communication skills
Experience in higher education and/or journalism
Experience in building/managing media outreach campaigns
Professional-level advanced training in public relations, journalism or communications

Bachelor’s degree in Public Relations, Journalism, Communications or related field and two years relevant experience or an equivalent combination of training and experience.

relevant experience or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
Experience in journalism or public relations or corporate communications.

Title: Enterprise Editor
Post_Date: an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
Dream Editor Job in Idaho’s Magic Valley

Lead the best work by Idaho’s best reporters, surrounded by mountains, rivers and the high desert sagebrush sea.

The Times-News in Twin Falls, Idaho, is seeking an enterprise editor in charge of our Big Story section, a four-page spread in every Sunday edition and special online presentation focusing on watchdog reporting, investigative journalism and top-notch storytelling.

Recent story examples include piecing together a string of pharmacy robberies that shed light on the nation’s opioid crisis, a three-part story on problems in Idaho’s foster care system, a multi-part project on the growing Hispanic population of a nearby city, a yearlong series following a refugee family who landed in Twin Falls the day the state’s governor announced he supported halting refugee arrivals, a package on a creative writing class in prison and a piece on Idaho’s dire rural doctor shortage.

You’ll work one-on-one with reporters and photographers in developing project ideas weeks or months in advance, methodically edit stories and guide the whole package through the design process.

This is a dream job for journalists who love fantastic storytelling and the kinds of pieces that change lives, laws and the way people think. Whether it’s a 1,000-word story that’s heavy on visual elements or a multi-part, 8,000-word package on how public policy affects real people locally, this job offers the opportunity to make the Big Story section your own.

You’ll also work with other managers on our daily digital strategy, assisting on breaking news when needed and pushing stories on social media.

This position holds a place on our editorial board and is in charge of writing two or three editorials a week.

This position also produces the weekly Outdoors page, giving you a chance to get out of the office and explore some of the most scenic settings in the United States. It’s one of our most popular feature sections and includes local columns and reader-submitted content.

The Magic Valley has a population of about 185,000 and is one of the fastest-growing communities in the Northwest. The economy is booming as it shifts from traditional agriculture to high-tech food science and manufacturing.

Chobani built the world’s largest yogurt factory here, and Clif Bar recently opened its first in-house bakery here. We are a family-friendly and affordable community with access to world-class skiing, and the best trout stream in the West an hour drive from your front door, not to mention access to kayaking, hiking, biking, rock climbing and hunting in all directions.

Downtown Twin Falls recently had a $17 million facelift, with new restaurants and shops opening all the time. We are two hours from Boise and three hours from Salt Lake City.


A year or more of editing and management experience at a daily is preferred
Must be comfortable using social media to promote stories.
Must be self-motivated, hyper-organized, innovative and creative.
Must be able to manage multiple deadlines and multiple priorities while maintaining professionalism in the workplace.
Possess a bachelor’s degree in journalism or related field or equivalent hands-on experience.

The Times-News is a 17,500-circulation daily newspaper (21,500 on Sundays) owned by Lee Enterprises. It offers a competitive salary, medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits, vacation, sick, holiday pay and 401K-retirement plan.

To apply, log on to

www.magicvalley.com/workhere

. Attach a cover letter, resume and three or four work samples that demonstrate a track record of success.

We are a drug-free workplace, and all applicants considered for employment must pass a post-offer drug screen prior to commencing employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Product Director (Editorial Emails, Newsletters & Messaging)
Post_Date: an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
T he New York Times seeks a passionate, experienced Product Director for its email team.

Email is an inherently personal medium, and The Times has millions of readers who invite us into their inboxes each day. The Times has long had a reputation for delivering innovative storytelling on our web site and in our apps, and we want someone who can come in and help drive forward that culture of innovation on our email and messaging products, too.

In this role that reaches across the organization, you will:
Oversee the product team that develops the email and push messaging systems that the Times uses to reach millions of readers each day.
Sets an ambitious product vision for how our newsletters can guide our readers to get the most out of their Times experience, drive engagement and move readers down the funnel from reader to subscriber.
Work closely with colleagues in the newsroom, marketing, advertising, design, product and technology to design, develop and launch individual newsletters, as well as making sure that we’re building the tools and systems we need to support a robust portfolio of innovative messaging products.

It’s a job that requires someone who can connect the dots across the business , and who can help turn the editorial vision of the newsroom into compelling email products that also drive the business forward.

You ideally have …
Strong experience in product management over email products, messaging and newsletters. This experienced product manager ideally has experience managing a portfolio of newsletters
Y ou have led cross-functional product, design and technology teams and can vigilantly prioritize in a rapidly-changing environment. You are versed in the best practices in agile product development.
An ability to problem solve in a highly collaborative culture. You are in your element at the intersection of editorial, technology, design and business. You work easily with colleagues to define and implement innovative solutions to complex problems and competing priorities.
A user-first mindset. You understand the importance of user research, data, testing and judgment in the product development process. You help the team evolve and optimize features and functionality by always advocating for what is best for the user. You’ll rely on a healthy balance between data-driven and user-centric design and decision-making
A love of email newsletters. You understand the unique opportunities email presents, whether it’s delivering a newsletter that clearly and succinctly sums up the news of the day for a mass audience, or a personalized email that speaks to the needs of an individual reader.

Responsibilities:
Own the overall product plan and roadmap. Working closely with senior leadership in product and design, engineering, and the newsroom, create clear quarterly plans, incorporating input from all stakeholders, that depict how the strategy will achieve the group’s goals.
Partner with editors and reporters in the newsroom, as well as designers and engineers, to develop strategies for more effectively utilizing these critical channels. Work closely with the newsroom, marketing and advertising to ensure all opportunities are being evaluated, tested and executed.
Collaborate with product designers and researchers to conduct user research, wireframe and prototype newsletters or messaging features.
Define and put in place metrics and systems to track product performance. Clearly communicate performance and use data to evaluate and prioritize the roadmap, as well as educating newsroom users how to interpret the results.
Be the product evangelist. Own all product communication with senior leadership on current insights and emerging trends, as well as championing the vision to the other teams and groups within the company.
Understand the workflow needs the journalists who create and produce email newsletters, and how they impact our team initiatives in the short-term and long-term. Develop a strategy for the creation and publishing capabilities that our email content management systems should support. Identify inefficient process in the current workflows, and identify tools to automate or streamline them.
Contribute to a culture of collaboration across all disciplines.

Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years of product management experience, editorial email or messaging focus
Strong understanding of the business model levers that drive an advertising and subscription business
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and in person.
An excellent grasp of the engineering challenges and core technologies that drive a media business
Strong knowledge of digital product development techniques and agile methodologies
Experience steering software developers and product designers
Excellent analytical skills with strong user empathy and awareness driven by qualitative and quantitative research methods
Real passion for The Times’s mission and a commitment to be a part of our innovation and growth

Title: Producer/Editor
Post_Date: an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
Working at The Weather Channel television network

We are Pattern. We are journalists, designers, scientists, and meteorologists. We are storytellers. We tell the stories behind the most fascinating weather and science phenomenon around the world...and beyond it. We tell you how our world works honestly and clearly so we can collective understand it and improve it.
Pattern is the provocative new brand from The Weather Channel television network focused on the intersection of climate, weather, science, technology, and culture. Our mission – as we grow rapidly – is to educate and fascinate through diverse and ambitious weather and science storytelling, both live from the field and in the studio. Pattern’s storytelling informs to evoke emotion, ignite conversation, and ultimately inspire action. Pattern combines the grit and agility of a start-up, with the support and resources of an established media company – The Weather Channel, which is the most trusted TV News Brand for 8 years in a row (and counting).
Pattern covers the most innovative developments in science, technology, and culture as well as the coolest, most beautiful places on earth – all from a unique weather lens. From live coverage of hurricanes, flash floods, tornadoes, and blizzards to production of immersive mixed reality experiences – join us as we explain what’s happening in the world, how we got here, and what it means for our future.
We are a small, scrappy team of globetrotting reporters, science geeks, creative design wizards, indie editors, and digital deal makers with the small and modest goal of changing the world. We embrace those who are passionate, view the world differently, and boldly challenge the status quo. We take great pride in the work we do and the smart, talented people who bring Pattern to life. The Social Media Editor helps guide the social strategy for NPR on each of its social platforms and evaluates the engagement and performance with the NPR audience. This Social Media editor role also works with other social media leads from across NPR, including NPR Music, Programming (podcasts), Marketing and sponsorship teams. Title: WFTX Managing Editor
Post_Date: an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
Desired: Management ExperienceTired of the cold and the snow? We currently have an exciting opportunity at FOX 4 WFTX-TV, The Scripps station in beautiful and warm sunny Ft Myers, Florida is searching for an innovative and aggressive Managing Editor. The successful candidate must be able to demonstrate the ability to create content gathering plans and daily systems that work collaboratively with reporters, photographers, multimedia journalists, the assignment desk, and editors.

The Managing Editor reports to the News Director and works closely with peers in executing the Scripps content strategy. This role is second in command of the newsroom and directly responsible for leading a large, shared-resource, content operations group that collects and distributes/publishes content for all platforms, so that local consumer expectations are met on all platforms including app, OTT audio/video, social, television and station website. This includes local content vision and strategy to address consumer needs, content standards, delivery, quality control and continuous improvement.

At FOX 4, we're In Your Corner. We're not afraid to take chances especially when those risks result in benefits for our community. We ask the tough questions and don't back down when the door slams in our face. We're telling the story from our viewers' perspective and we'll keep pushing until we find a solution to the problem. With Storm Shield, we keep our audiences up to date on the all-important topic of weather and our storm predictions become life-saving information during hurricane season.

Key activities

Collaborates with News Director to leverage the Scripps content strategy as the foundation for specific local content strategy.
Leads the daily editorial process so that all assignments are executed and delivered on time and of the highest possible quality.
Partners with peers to allocate coverage resources for all coverage, often in a frequently-changing news environment.
Oversees the management of daily and real-time flow of editorial information into the newsroom and out to field crews.
Hires, schedules and oversees the management of assignment desk, and other content gatherers to deliver our news product.
Ensures logistics operate smoothly, are monitored and perform to expectations.
Serves as a storytelling coach and mentor to content gatherers.
Engages peers and staff in the design, measurement and continuous improvement of newsroom workflow.
Uses market knowledge/resources for content discovery.
Manages shifting priorities and conflicts regarding limited resources with effective communication, negotiation and collaboration.
Reviews copy, provides coaching and guidance.
Provides coaching and development of assignment and reporting staff to ensure the strategy for our content is understood and followed.
Develops a pipeline of reporting talent for this and other Scripps local media businesses.
Responsible for assignment and reporting budgetary planning and monitoring.
Other duties as assigned.
Education & Experience/Certifications

Bachelor's degree in Journalism or related field required.
3 years of management experience in content media departments preferred.
Experience turning news shows around to improve business results preferred.
Skills & Abilities

Command skills: comfortable leading, can take unpopular stand if necessary, encourages healthy, direct and tough debate but isn't afraid to end it and move on, is looked to for direction in a crisis, maintains composure and respect even in very high pressure situations.
Journalism: Skilled storyteller, journalistic ethics and libel.
Working knowledge of news operations on multiple platforms.
Advanced interpersonal communication skills.
Customer focus: understands customer needs, raises the bar on customer service, develops unified approach to exceed customer expectations.
Very strong collaborator: involves others in problem solving and decision making, asks for and considers an array of perspectives, comfortable relying on the expertise of others and joint decision making.
Manage execution: setting expectations, delegating, facilitating, removing barriers, measuring performance, and fostering accountability/recognition.
Engage and inspire at all levels: create environment where people feel appreciated, and valued, are committed and want to excel, and want to define opportunities to improve the organization.
Manage conflict: Constructive in working through differences, handles recurrent conflict, resolves issues between employees, preserves relationships.
Decision making: Ties decisions to strategy, uses sound logic, makes decisions at the right time, brings others into decision making process, chooses the best alternative.
Coach: Continuously cultivates capabilities by asking the right questions and equipping staff with tools, knowledge and opportunities they need to develop themselves.
Delegation: is clear about lines of responsibility, allows staff to make mistakes, offers guidance without taking over, enables team to manage daily operation of their teams.
About Scripps

Title: Adjunct Instructor, Spies Like Us: Operational Security and Tradecraft for Journalists
Description:
Desired: Teaching ExperienceThe Annenberg School of Journalism at the University of Southern California seeks a highly qualified adjunct instructor to teach JOUR 499 Spies Like Us: Operational Security and Tradecraft for Journalists.

This course teaches journalists advanced techniques for effectively and safely reporting on sensitive, difficult and potentially dangerous subjects. We will approach the enterprise of reporting from the standpoint of an intelligence officer, borrowing the best tradecraft that spies, federal agents, police officers, and analysts use to find sources, evaluate their credibility, elicit information from them, analyze that information, and protect the agents of information from legal (and perhaps) physical jeopardy. We will re-reverse engineer the tactics, techniques and procedures that are used against journalists with the aim of protecting and hardening the reporting process itself.

We will identify threats to the physical safety and welfare (online and offline) of journalists, threats to the security of their reporting and their communications, and threats to sources, and we will work on a set of best practices to defend and mitigate these threats.

We will practice real-world scenarios, including counter-surveillance detection, source meetings, reporting from the scenes of active emergencies, and basic situational awareness. We’ll use case studies, interview subject matter experts, and experiment with new technology.

By the end of the course, students will be expected to think strategically and creatively about the security of themselves, their sources, their publications and their reporting teammates.

Requirements for consideration include a B.A., B.S., M.S., or an M.A. degree in a related field. Previous teaching experience is desirable. For some courses, outstanding professional experience may be substituted for academic credentials.

The instructor for this class must have at least ten years of experience as a sworn agent of a federal law enforcement agency, or as an operations officer or analyst with an intelligence agency; direct experience dealing with the press in that capacity is preferred, as is a demonstrated commitment to the first principles of journalism. A knowledge of basic reporting practices, investigatory tradecraft, cyber security issues and national security law would be a plus.

The USC Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism is among the nation’s leading institutions devoted to the study of communication, journalism and public relations. With an enrollment of 2,400 undergraduate and graduate students, USC Annenberg scholars, both students and faculty, are defining these fields for the 21st century and beyond.
